q: Be content with what you have, rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
h:
“Be content with what you have, rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Understanding that rests in what it does not understand is the finest.
h:
“Understanding that rests in what it does not understand is the finest.” —
Zhuangzi

q: Bad things are not the worst things that an happen to us. NOTHING is the worst thing that can happen to us.
h:
“Bad things are not the worst things that an happen to us. NOTHING is the worst thing that can happen to us.” —
Richard Bach

q: Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you.
h:
“Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you. ” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: You win more from losing than winning.
h:
“You win more from losing than winning.” —
Morgan Wootten

q: Honor is the foundation of courage.
h:
“Honor is the foundation of courage.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: There is a wisdom of the head, and there is a wisdom of the heart.
h:
“There is a wisdom of the head, and there is a wisdom of the heart.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Talk does not cook rice.
h:
“Talk does not cook rice.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Trust is the glue that holds people together and is the lubricant that keeps an organization moving forward.
h:
“Trust is the glue that holds people together and is the lubricant that keeps an organization moving forward.” —
Colin Powell

q: There are as many opinions as there are experts.
h:
“There are as many opinions as there are experts.” —
Franklin D. Roosevelt

q: Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
h:
“Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: The human mind defines things in relation to one another – without light the notion of darkness would be unintelligible.
h:
“The human mind defines things in relation to one another – without light the notion of darkness would be unintelligible.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: Originality is the fine art of remembering what you hear but forgetting where you heard it.
h:
“Originality is the fine art of remembering what you hear but forgetting where you heard it. ” —
Laurence J. Peter

q: The dreamers are the saviors of the worlds.
h:
“The dreamers are the saviors of the worlds.” —
James Allen

q: There's no next time. It's now or never.
h:
“There's no next time. It's now or never.” —
Celestine Chua

q: If the plan doesn't work, change the plan, but never the goal.
h:
“If the plan doesn't work, change the plan, but never the goal.” —
Unknown

q: The greatest weariness comes from work not done.
h:
“The greatest weariness comes from work not done.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.
h:
“The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.” —
Vince Lombardi

q: Always try to be a little kinder than necessary.
h:
“Always try to be a little kinder than necessary.” —
James Matthew Barrie

q: It isn't what you do, but how you do it.
h:
“It isn't what you do, but how you do it.” —
John Wooden

q: Think and wonder, wonder and think.
h:
“Think and wonder, wonder and think.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
h:
“Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life. ” —
Seneca

q: Dance first. Think later. It's the natural order.
h:
“Dance first. Think later. It's the natural order.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.
h:
“Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.
h:
“Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.” —
John Wooden

q: The outer conditions of a person's life will always be found to reflect their inner beliefs.
h:
“The outer conditions of a person's life will always be found to reflect their inner beliefs.” —
James Allen

q: My favorite things in life don't cost any money. It's really clear that the most precious resource we all have is time.
h:
“My favorite things in life don't cost any money. It's really clear that the most precious resource we all have is time.” —
Steve Jobs

q: Exceptional thinkers ignore their critics and go about their business making history.
h:
“Exceptional thinkers ignore their critics and go about their business making history.” —
John Eliot

q: Trusting our intuition often saves us from disaster.
h:
“Trusting our intuition often saves us from disaster. ” —
Anne Wilson Schaef

q: Treat every moment as your last. It is not preparation for something else.
h:
“Treat every moment as your last. It is not preparation for something else.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: If you correct your mind, the rest of your life will fall into place.
h:
“If you correct your mind, the rest of your life will fall into place.” —
Lao Tzu

q: When reading, only read. When eating, only eat. When thinking, only think.
h:
“When reading, only read. When eating, only eat. When thinking, only think.” —
Seungsahn

q: You cannot always control what goes on outside. But you can always control what goes on inside.
h:
“You cannot always control what goes on outside. But you can always control what goes on inside. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: Make no small plans for they have no power to stir the soul.
h:
“Make no small plans for they have no power to stir the soul.” —
Niccolo Machiavelli

q: So long as we are being remembered, we remain alive.
h:
“So long as we are being remembered, we remain alive.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.
h:
“Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: As you think, you travel, and as you love, you attract.
h:
“As you think, you travel, and as you love, you attract.” —
James Allen

q: Make each day your masterpiece.
h:
“Make each day your masterpiece.” —
John Wooden

q: I learned the value of hard work by working hard.
h:
“I learned the value of hard work by working hard. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.
h:
“First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.” —
Epictetus

q: Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.
h:
“Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.” —
Charles Dickens

q: The swift wind of compromise is a lot more devastating than the sudden jolt of misfortune.
h:
“The swift wind of compromise is a lot more devastating than the sudden jolt of misfortune. ” —
Charles Swindoll

q: Making money isn't hard in itself... What's hard is to earn it doing something worth devoting one's life to.
h:
“Making money isn't hard in itself... What's hard is to earn it doing something worth devoting one's life to.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Our heart is a treasury; if you pour out all its wealth at once, you are bankrupt.
h:
“Our heart is a treasury; if you pour out all its wealth at once, you are bankrupt.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.
h:
“Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Every time we liberate a woman, we liberate a man.
h:
“Every time we liberate a woman, we liberate a man. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: Live in each season as it passes; breathe the air, drink the drink, taste the fruit, and resign yourself to the influence of the earth.
h:
“Live in each season as it passes; breathe the air, drink the drink, taste the fruit, and resign yourself to the influence of the earth.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: Unless a man is master of his soul, all other kinds of mastery amount to little.
h:
“Unless a man is master of his soul, all other kinds of mastery amount to little.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Make each day a new horizon.
h:
“Make each day a new horizon.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: The businessman's tool is value.
h:
“The businessman's tool is value.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Just do what must be done. This may not be happiness but it is greatness.
h:
“Just do what must be done. This may not be happiness but it is greatness.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Acknowledging the good that you already have in your life is the foundation for all abundance.
h:
“Acknowledging the good that you already have in your life is the foundation for all abundance.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: When you win, say nothing, when you lose say less.
h:
“When you win, say nothing, when you lose say less.” —
Wayne Gretzky

q: Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed.
h:
“Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed.” —
William Faulkner

q: The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.
h:
“The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: There is no excuse for not trying.
h:
“There is no excuse for not trying.” —
Barack Obama

q: Life is a constant series of opportunities.
h:
“Life is a constant series of opportunities.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans.
h:
“If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans. ” —
Woody Allen

q: Be a master of change rather than a victim of change.
h:
“Be a master of change rather than a victim of change.” —
Brian Tracy

q: To be totally at leisure for one day is to be immortal for one day.
h:
“To be totally at leisure for one day is to be immortal for one day. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: As mortals, we're ruled by conditions, not by ourselves.
h:
“As mortals, we're ruled by conditions, not by ourselves.” —
Bodhidharma

q: Intense love does not measure, it just gives.
h:
“Intense love does not measure, it just gives.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Be content with what you have, rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
h:
“Be content with what you have, rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Grudges are for those who insist that they are owed something; forgiveness, however, is for those who are substantial enough to move on.
h:
“Grudges are for those who insist that they are owed something; forgiveness, however, is for those who are substantial enough to move on.” —
Criss Jami

q: The Law of Concentration states that whatever you dwell upon grows. The more you think about something, the more it becomes part of your reality.
h:
“The Law of Concentration states that whatever you dwell upon grows. The more you think about something, the more it becomes part of your reality.” —
Brian Tracy

q: It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love.
h:
“It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love.” —
John Lennon

q: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
h:
“Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.” —
Albert Einstein

q: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
h:
“By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
h:
“If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Your hardest times often lead to the greatest moments of your life. Keep going. Tough situations build strong people in the end.
h:
“Your hardest times often lead to the greatest moments of your life. Keep going. Tough situations build strong people in the end.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.
h:
“Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.” —
Wayne Gretzky

q: Others can stop you temporarily – you are the only one who can do it permanently.
h:
“Others can stop you temporarily – you are the only one who can do it permanently.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
h:
“Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: Definiteness of purpose is the starting point of all achievement.
h:
“Definiteness of purpose is the starting point of all achievement. ” —
W. Clement Stone

q: Why do you stay in prison when the door is so wide open?
h:
“Why do you stay in prison when the door is so wide open?” —
Rumi

q: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
h:
“A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Pleasure can be supported by an illusion; but happiness rests upon truth.
h:
“Pleasure can be supported by an illusion; but happiness rests upon truth. ” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
h:
“What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
h:
“The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: Allow motion to equal emotion.
h:
“Allow motion to equal emotion.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: Change the changeable, accept the unchangeable, and remove yourself from the unacceptable.
h:
“Change the changeable, accept the unchangeable, and remove yourself from the unacceptable. ” —
Denis Waitley

q: Your happiness is what truly matters most. Do what you have to do in order to be happy.
h:
“Your happiness is what truly matters most. Do what you have to do in order to be happy.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Be like a postage stamp. Stick to it until you get there.
h:
“Be like a postage stamp. Stick to it until you get there.” —
Bob Proctor

q: Your imagination is your preview of life's coming attractions.
h:
“Your imagination is your preview of life's coming attractions.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Victory is always possible for the person who refuses to stop fighting.
h:
“Victory is always possible for the person who refuses to stop fighting.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: If you want something you've never had you must be willing to do something you've never done.
h:
“If you want something you've never had you must be willing to do something you've never done.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: A good teacher opens the door for you, but you must enter the room by yourself.
h:
“A good teacher opens the door for you, but you must enter the room by yourself.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Confuse them with your silence and amaze them with your actions.
h:
“Confuse them with your silence and amaze them with your actions.” —
Unknown

q: I wasn't brave, I just didn't have time to be scared.
h:
“I wasn't brave, I just didn't have time to be scared.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.
h:
“The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.” —
Alfred Adler

q: Poetry is written with tears, fiction with blood, and history with invisible ink.
h:
“Poetry is written with tears, fiction with blood, and history with invisible ink.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Life is like underwear, should be changed twice a day.
h:
“Life is like underwear, should be changed twice a day. ” —
Ray Bradbury

q: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
h:
“We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.
h:
“Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.” —
Sun Tzu

q: The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success.
h:
“The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success. ” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Just because something isn't a lie does not mean that it isn't deceptive.
h:
“Just because something isn't a lie does not mean that it isn't deceptive.” —
Criss Jami

q: The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.
h:
“The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.
h:
“The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.” —
Robert Greene

q: Know your gifts and share them.
h:
“Know your gifts and share them.” —
Les Brown

q: Force has no place where there is need of skill.
h:
“Force has no place where there is need of skill. ” —
Herodotus
